text.p: Cleanup continues along the Red River in the upper Plains of the USA and in southern Manitoba, Canada, near Winnepeg. The next chance for moderate rain in the area does not come until late in the week. Rainfall so far this month has averaged below normal.

Tropical cyclone 36s will main threaten shipping in the southeast Indian Ocean during the next 72 hours. The system is currently near 12s/92e with winds up to 50 mph. It should east and then southeast during this period. Top winds may reach 60-65 mph during this time.
There are no further statements at this time.
